title: Thawing Cryopreserved Human Islets

ABCDEF
1M199 (10L) SupplierSupplier Catalogue #Link
2M199 powder 9.41g/L 1 bottles (1x10L/bottle) Mediatech-Corning90050PB 3
3NaHCO3 26 mM 22.0g Fisher ScientificS233-500
4HEPES 10 mM 23.83g Fisher ScientificBP310-1
5Penicillin/Streptomycin 100 U/ml penicillin and 100 μg/ml streptomycin50ml Lonza09-757F
6

Freeze M199:
Prepare Freeze M199 solution as follows:
Add 100ml heat inactivated FBS (HyClone™ Fetal Bovine Serum (Canada), Characterized - Fisher cat# SH3039603) to 900ml M199
Store at 4oC. Warm to room temperature for use.
Heat inactivation of FBS
  1. Thaw serum and aliquot into labelled 50ml tubes. If serum was thawed in a refrigerator allow serum to come to room temperature prior to placing in water bath.
  2. Fill the water-bath with sufficient water so that the tubes may be submersed to the level of the serum.
  3. Set water-bath temperature to maintain the product at 56°C.
  4. Once 56°C is reached, place the tubes in the water-bath for 30 minutes.
  5. After 30 minutes immediately remove the tubes from the water bath.
  6. Store the tubes of heat inactivated FBS @ -20°C.

Prepare 0.75M sucrose freeze M199 and place on ice.
  1. Weigh 12.836 g sucrose and transfer to a 50 ml beaker.
  2. Add 30 ml of freeze M199 (as above) and mix until in solution
  3. Transfer sucrose solution to a 50 ml volumetric flask, add freeze M199 to bring total volume to 50 ml.
  4. Filter sterilize with a 0.22 um cellulose acetate filter.
Remove tubes of cryo preserved human islets from Liquid Nitrogen dewar and place into portable bath containing liquid nitrogen.
Immerse and agitate tubes in 37ºC water bath until almost thawed (WARNING: do not over thaw the cells, remove tube from waterbath when last small piece of ice is still present).
Transfer to 4ºC ice slush.
Centrifuge tubes at 282 x g for 1 min at 4ºC
Remove supernatant

Add 1mL of cold 0.75M sucrose. Lightly hand vortex to get pellet back into suspension.
Hold on ice slush for 30 min.
Transfer the samples to room temperature for 1 minute.
Add 1mL of freeze M199 and incubate for 5 min.
Add 1mL of freeze M199 and incubate for 5 min.
Add 2mL of freeze M199 and incubate for 5 min.
Add 4mL of freeze M199 and incubate for 5 min.
Centrifuge the sample tubes at 282 x g for 1min at Room temperature.
Remove supernatant and add 5ml of Human Islet Culture media and lightly hand vortex to allow the islets to go into suspension.

Using Human Islet Culture media, culture islets at 22°C - 5% CO2 or use for experiments. It is recomended to hand pick the islets to purity as soon as possible after thawing.

materials.name: EMD Millipore™ Stericup™ Sterile Vacuum Filter Units

description:
This protocol details the thawing of human islets following their cryopreservation, as performed by the Alberta Diabetes Institute IsletCore. The crypreservation method is detailed in Human Islet Cryopreservation protocol.
Human islets cryopreserved and thawed using these methods have been found to retain viability and function after 20years of cryogenic biobanking.
Manning Fox JE, Lyon J, Dai XQ, Wright RC, Hayward J, van de Bunt M, Kin T, Shapiro AMJ, McCarthy MI, Gloyn AL, Ungrin MD, Lakey JR, Kneteman NM, Warnock GL, Korbutt GS, Rajotte RV, MacDonald PE (2015) Human islet function following 20 years of cryogenic biobanking. Diabetologia, 58(7): 1503-1512.
